item.title: Configuration files overview
item.description: My configuration for org-mode is reasonably complex. Reading through a long lisp file when making changes became cumbersome. I broke the configuration up into a series of files in the config/org/ path. Each file has it’s own purpose to make tracking down and updating configuration values easier. File Description config_variables.el org variable configuration capture-templates.el templates to capture tasks agenda.el agenda specific configuration babel.

item.title: Configuration files config_variables
item.description: The lisp file config_variables.el contains a set of org-related configuration variables. If there is some minor setup that goes along with setting the variable, that is allowed as well. Variable Setting Purpose PATH /Library/TeX/texbin: appends the latex binary to the path org-agenda-files ~/Documents/tasks/ The location of org files that are used to build an agenda org-agenda-log-mode-items “closed state” Show closed tasks in agenda view org-refile-targets org-agenda-files .

item.title: Configuration file: functions
item.description: The functions.el file within my org-mode config is simply that. Function definitions take up a lot of space, and in my org-mode config, there are a few that are very verbose. I’ve pulled them all into this file in order to make the remainder more readable. In here I have a set of functions from Bert Hansen’s org-mode configuration: Function Purpose bh/hide-other collapse all trees but the one you are currently working in (<f9> h) bh/make-org-scratch create a scratch.

item.title: Configuration files babel
item.description: Babel enables source blocks in org-mode. The following languages are supported by default. Additional requirements may be necessary to install. For install requirements, so the orgmode page on languages. The following languages are configured: Language python shell R org sql sass sed awk css calc gnuplot dot (graphviz) java javascript (js) lisp makefile browser http Having language support in org-mode is very powerful.
